name: pyrinoline
source: Bergstrom C. A. S.; Norinder U.; Luthman K.; Artursson P. Molecular Descriptors Influencing Melting Point and Their Role in Classification of Solid Drugs. J. Chem. Inf. Comput. Sci.; (Article); 2003; 43(4); 1177-1432
Reason: The base structure of pyrinoline is a fused aromatic ring system, which significantly increases the melting point due to the rigidity and aromaticity of the molecule. The presence of multiple fused rings and the nitro functional group also contribute to the increased melting point. The nitro group is known to increase the melting point due to its ability to engage in strong intermolecular forces such as dipole-dipole interactions and potential hydrogen bonding. The fused rings also add to the melting point due to their increased rigidity and aromaticity. The molecular weight and complexity of the molecule also contribute to the increased melting point.
